title: Tegan and Sara
text:
{{short description|Canadian indie rock/indie pop duo}} {{Copy edit|date=August 2022}} {{Use Canadian English|date=August 2015}} {{Use mdy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Tegan and Sara | image = Tegan and Sara Hillside 2014 (cropped).jpg | caption = Tegan and Sara post-concert at July 2014 [[Hillside Festival]] | image_size = | landscape = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1980|9|19}} | birth_name = Tegan Rain Quin
Sara Keirsten Quin | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Calgary]], [[Alberta]], Canada | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Indie pop]] * [[indie folk]] * [[synthpop]] * [[indie rock]] * [[Pop music|pop]]{{cite web|last=Sia|first=Nicole| url=https://www.spin.com/2012/09/tegan-and-sara-closer-listen/|title=Tegan and Sara Get 'Closer' to Synthpop on New Song: Listen|work=SPIN|publisher=Spin Media|date=September 20, 2012}} }} | years_active = 1995–present | label = {{flatlist| * Vapor * [[Sire Records|Sire]] * [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]] * Mom & Pop }} | website = {{URL|teganandsara.com}} | current_members = * Tegan Quin * Sara Quin }} '''Tegan and Sara''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|t|iː|ɡ|ən|,_|ˈ|s|ɛər|ə}}) are a Canadian [[indie pop]] duo formed in 1998 in [[Calgary]], [[Alberta]], composed of [[identical twin]] sisters '''Tegan Rain Quin''' and '''Sara Keirsten Quin''' (born September 19, 1980).{{cite news|url= https://www.upi.com/Top_News/2019/09/19/UPI-Almanac-for-Thursday-Sept-19-2019/9271568769907//|title= UPI Almanac for Thursday, Sept. 19, 2019|work= [[United Press International]] | date= September 19, 2019|access-date=June 7, 2020 | archive-date= September 20, 2019|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20190920063558/https://www.upi.com/Top_News/2019/09/19/UPI-Almanac-for-Thursday-Sept-19-2019/9271568769907/|url-status=live|quote=...singer Sara Quin in 1980 (age 39); singer Tegan Quin in 1980 (age 39)}} Both musicians are songwriters and multi-instrumentalists.{{cite news|url=http://media.www.thelantern.com/media/storage/paper333/news/2007/11/16/Arts/Columbus.Arts.Briefs-3107593.shtml|title=Columbus Arts Briefs|date=November 16, 2007|work=The Lantern|publisher=Ohio State University|access-date=March 26, 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080325062854/http://media.www.thelantern.com/media/storage/paper333/news/2007/11/16/Arts/Columbus.Arts.Briefs-3107593.shtml |archive-date=March 25, 2008}}{{cite book|last1=Quin|first1=Tegan|last2=Quin|first2=Sara|title=AT|series=ON, IN, AT|year=2009|page=7}}{{cite web|url=http://www.teganandsara.com/about/|title=About|website=Teganandsara.com}} The pair have released nine studio albums. They earned a [[Grammy Award|Grammy]] nomination in 2012 for their DVD/[[Album#Live|live album]] ''[[Get Along (video album)|Get Along]]''.{{Cite web|url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/artists/tegan-sara|title=GRAMMY Award Results for Tegan & Sara|website=grammy.com|access-date=September 28, 2019}} Their tenth album, ''Crybaby'', was released on October 21, 2022.{{Cite news|url=https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/tegan-sara-announce-album-crybaby-160505030.html|title=Tegan and Sara Announce New Album Crybaby, Fall 2022 Tour Dates|last=Anderson|first=Cayrs|date=July 12, 2022|work=Yahoo}} Their memoir, ''[[High School (book)|High School]]'', was released on September 24, 2019. The TV show ''[[High School (2022 TV series)|High School]]'' based on the memoir was released on [[Amazon Freevee]] in the fall of 2022.{{cite web | url=https://trevordecker.com/2022/06/02/filming-wraps-on-new-freevee-series-based-on-tegan-and-saras-teen-years/ | title=Filming Wraps on New Freevee Series Based on Tegan and Sara's Teen Years | date=June 2, 2022 }} ==History== === 1995–2002: Background and early work === [[File:Teganandsara.jpg|thumb|Tegan and Sara at [[Terminal 5 (venue)|Terminal 5]], New York City, October 6, 2008]] Tegan and Sara began playing guitar and writing songs at age 15, using an old guitar they found in their basement owned by their then-stepfather, Bruce. One of the first songs they wrote was ''Tegan Didn't Go To School Today'', originally written by Sara. They later sang and recorded the song together on a cassette tape. They first called their band Plunk, defined as ''{{'}}light punk''' as they had neither a drummer nor [[bassist|bass player]] at the time. In 1997, they used their school's recording studio to record two demo albums: ''Who's in Your Band?'' and ''Play Day''. In 1998, they won [[Calgary]]'s "Garage Warz" competition; using the studio time they won in this competition, they recorded their first professional demo under the name "Sara and Tegan",{{cite web |title=Everything Tegan and Sara: Yellow/Red/Orange Demo Tapes |url=http://everythingteganandsara.blogspot.com/2013/09/yellowredorange-demo-tapes.html |website=Everything Tegan and Sara |access-date=31 March 2019}}{{cite web |title=Sara and Tegan - Yellow Demo (1998) |url=http://www.calgarycassettes.org/2011/06/sara-and-tegan-yellow-demo-1998.html |access-date=31 March 2019}} ''Yellow tape.'' This was followed by ''Orange tape'' and ''Red tape''. Their first "big-time show" was in May 1998 in Calgary, opening for [[Hayden (musician)|Hayden]].{{cite news |last=Wilton |first=Lisa |date=May 29, 1998 |title=Twin teens are talk of the town |url=http://www.teganandsara.org/library/articles/d_2000.02.17_p_ottawasunnewspaper.html |work=Calgary Herald |access-date=2019-10-03 }} In 1999, they released their debut album ''[[Under Feet Like Ours]]'' independently under the "Sara and Tegan" name, with producer [[Jared Kuemper]].{{cite web|last=Snapes|first=Laura|url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/laurasnapes/how-the-rest-of-the-world-caught-up-to-tegan-and-sara|title=Tegan & Sara are from the Future|date=April 7, 2016|publisher=BuzzFeed Inc.|website=buzzfeed.com|access-date=April 29, 2016}} Two songs from ''Red tape'' appeared on the album, and two from ''Orange tape''. They later changed their name to "Tegan and Sara" because people thought they were a solo act named "Sara Antegan". Their first album was later reprinted under the name "Tegan and Sara". The same year, they signed with [[Neil Young]]'s Vapor Records and released ''[[This Business of Art]]'' through the label in 2000. Since then, they have toured extensively. === 2002–2011: Mainstream success === In 2002, Tegan and Sara released their third album, ''[[If It Was You]]''. Their fourth album, ''[[So Jealous]]'', was released in 2004 and led to wider success and attention, both locally and internationally. This album was released through both Vapor and [[Sanctuary Records|Sanctuary]]. One track of the album, "Walking with a Ghost",[https://noisey.vice.com/en_ca/article/a-completely-biased-ranking-of-the-60-best-canadian-indie-rock-songs-of-the-00s-part-ii "A Completely Biased Ranking of the 60 Best Canadian Indie Rock Songs of the 00s Part II"]. ''Vice'', Cam Lindsay April 10, 2017 was covered by [[the White Stripes]], who released it on their ''[[Walking with a Ghost (EP)|Walking with a Ghost]]'' EP.{{cite web|url=http://uk.askmen.com/women/singer_300/388c_tegan_and_sara.html|title=Tegan & Sara Biography|publisher=AskMen.com|access-date=March 26, 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120415155251/http://uk.askmen.com/celebs/women/singer_300/388_tegan_and_sara.html|archive-date=April 15, 2012|df=mdy-all}} The band's 2007 album, ''[[The Con (album)|The Con]]'', was released by Vapor and [[Sire Records|Sire]] because Sanctuary chose to no longer release new music in the United States. The album was co-produced by [[Chris Walla]]. [[Jason McGerr]] of [[Death Cab for Cutie]], [[Matt Sharp]] of [[the Rentals]] (and previously [[Weezer]]), [[Hunter Burgan]] of [[AFI (band)|AFI]], and [[Kaki King]] all appeared and collaborated on the album.{{cite web|url=http://www.absolutepunk.net/showthread.php?t=215184|title=Tegan & Sara Update|last=Foucart|first=Jon|date=February 22, 2007|website=AbsolutePunk|access-date=March 26, 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120630011526/http://www.absolutepunk.net/showthread.php?t=215184 |archive-date=June 30, 2012}} On October 26, 2009, Tegan and Sara released their sixth album, ''[[Sainthood (album)|Sainthood]]'', produced by [[Chris Walla]] and [[Howard Redekopp]]. The duo also put out a three-volume book set titled ''ON, IN, AT'', which is a collection of stories, essays, journals, and photos of the band on tour in America in late 2008, writing together in [[New Orleans]], and touring Australia. The photographs in the book are taken by Lindsey Byrnes and Ryan Russell. The album ''Sainthood'' debuted on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart at number 21 selling 24,000 copies in its first week.{{cite news|url=http://teganandsara.com/news/on-in-at-the-tegan-and-sara-books/|title=ON, IN, AT|last=Quin|first=Tegan|date=September 11, 2009|publisher=Tegan and Sara|access-date=March 26, 2010}} While recording ''Sainthood'', Tegan and Sara spent a week writing songs together in New Orleans. The song "Paperback Head" was the only song written by the pair to appear on the album, making it the first song on any Tegan and Sara album that they wrote together.{{cite news|url=https://www.spin.com/2009/11/tegan-and-sara-across-crowded-womb/|title=Tegan and Sara: Across a Crowded Womb|last=Eells|first=Josh|date=November 11, 2009|work=Spin|access-date=March 26, 2010}} [[Spin (magazine)|''Spin'' magazine]] gave ''Sainthood'' four out of five stars and wrote, "Tegan and Sara's music may no longer be the stuff of teens, but its strength remains in how much it feels like two people talking."{{cite news|url=http://www.spin.com/reviews/tegan-and-sara-sainthood-vaporsire|title=Tegan and Sara, 'Sainthood' (Vapor/Sire) |last=Wood|first=Mikael|work=Spin|access-date=March 26, 2010}} [[File:Tegan and sara at the polaris music prize gala 2010 by dustin rabin.jpg|thumb|Tegan and Sara performing at the [[Polaris Music Prize]] Gala 2010]] In 2011, they launched "2011: A Merch Odyssey", which saw at least one new item in the official online stores every month, all year long. A live CD/DVD combination package titled ''Get Along'' was released on November 15 and contains three films titled "States", "India", and "For the Most Part". ''Get Along'' was nominated in the [[55th Annual Grammy Awards|2013 Grammy Awards]] for [[Grammy Award for Best Music Film|Best Long Form Music Video]].{{cite web|title=Grammy Nominations|url=http://www.grammy.com/nominees|access-date=December 6, 2012}} === 2012–2018: ''Heartthrob'', ''Love You to Death'', and ''The Con X: Covers'' === Tegan and Sara started recording their seventh studio album, ''[[Heartthrob (album)|Heartthrob]]'', on February 20, 2012. Eight songs were produced by [[Greg Kurstin]]. [[Joey Waronker]] contributed drums to these songs. Two songs were produced by [[Mike Elizondo]], with [[Victor Indrizzo]] contributing drums, Josh Lopez contributing guitar, and [[Dave Palmer (American keyboardist)|Dave Palmer]] contributing piano. The last two songs were produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen. The first single, "[[Closer (Tegan and Sara song)|Closer]]", was released on September 25, 2012. The album was released on January 29, 2013 and debuted on the Billboard top 200 at number 3, the band's highest charting record to date, selling 49,000 copies in its first week.{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1537980/justin-bieber-scores-fifth-no-1-album-on-billboard-200-chart|title=Tegan and Sara, 'Billboard' |last=Caulfield|first=Keith|magazine=Billboard|access-date=February 11, 2013}} ''Heartthrob'' debuted at number 2 on the Canadian chart, digital downloads chart and hit number 1 on the rock and alternative album charts.{{cite web|last=Norris |first=John |url=http://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/tegan_and_sara_discuss_new_album/ |title=Tegan and Sara Discuss New Album: Seventh Album Due Out in Early 2013 | Under The Radar |publisher=Undertheradarmag.com |access-date=January 31, 2013}} In July 2013, the album was shortlisted for the [[2013 Polaris Music Prize]].{{cite magazine|date=July 16, 2013|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1858744/tegan-and-sara-metric-make-the-polaris-music-prize-short-list|title=Tegan and Sara, Metric Make the Polaris Music Prize Short List|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=February 1, 2014}} In March 2014, Tegan and Sara won three [[Juno Award]]s for [[Juno Award for Single of the Year|Single of the Year]], [[Juno Award for Pop Album of the Year|Pop Album of the Year]], and [[Juno Award for Group of the Year|Group of the Year]]. Tegan and Sara finished their eighth studio album on November 30, 2015. On March 10, 2016, the band announced via their [[Facebook]] account that the album's title would be ''[[Love You to Death (album)|Love You to Death]]'', with the release date set for June 3. They released the [[lead single]] from the album, "[[Boyfriend (Tegan and Sara song)|Boyfriend]]", on April 8. On April 25, tour dates were announced for their 2016 worldwide tour for the ''Love You to Death'' album. The duo released a music video for each track on the album. For the tenth anniversary of the release of their album ''The Con'', Tegan and Sara collaborated with 17 artists including [[Cyndi Lauper]] to create ''The Con X: Covers'' in 2017. The participating artists created covers of ''The Con''{{'}}s original songs which created a cohesive album sold to benefit the Tegan and Sara Foundation. Tegan and Sara also toured an acoustic version of ''The Con'' in 2017 with a portion of the proceeds supporting the Tegan and Sara Foundation.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/tegan-and-sara-covers-album-2140242|title=Tegan and Sara covers album will feature Grimes, CHVRCHES and Ryan Adams - NME|date=2017-09-13|work=NME|access-date=2018-08-24|language=en-US}} On December 11, 2018, Tegan and Sara announced a memoir entitled ''[[High School (book)|High School]]'', sharing the story of their youth, to be released in fall 2019, along with new music.{{Cite web|url=https://teganandsara.com/happy-new-year/|title=Happy New Year! {{!}} Tegan and Sara|website=teganandsara.com|access-date=2019-03-01|date=January 2019}}{{Cite web|url=https://teganandsara.com/high-school-a-memoir/|title=High School, a memoir {{!}} Tegan and Sara|website=teganandsara.com|access-date=2019-03-01|date=December 11, 2018}} === 2019–2020: ''Hey, I'm Just Like You'' and memoir === In May 2018 at Out Web Fest, Tegan stated they were working on a book, podcast, and new record.{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WQfzqHJvPhQ| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211117/WQfzqHJvPhQ| archive-date=2021-11-17 | url-status=live|title=Tegan Quin from Tegan and Sara at the Opening Night of Out Web Fest|website=Youtube.com}}{{cbignore}} Their memoir, ''[[High School (book)|High School]]'', was published on September 24, 2019 by MCD Books, a division of [[Farrar, Straus and Giroux]], alongside [[Simon & Schuster|Simon & Schuster Canada]] and [[Virago Press]] in the United Kingdom.{{Cite web|url=https://www.mcdbooks.com/books/high-school |title = Tegan + Sara: High School|website=mcdbooks.com|access-date=September 28, 2019}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/books/in-high-school-tegan-and-sara-quin-reflect-on-coming-out-and-hitting-it-big/2019/09/17/f2ece55e-d59d-11e9-9343-40db57cf6abd_story.html|title=In 'High School,' Tegan and Sara Quin reflect on coming out and hitting it big|last=Dunn|first=Jancee|date=September 17, 2019|newspaper=The Washington Post}} In early 2019, Tegan and Sara announced they were working on their next record for release later that year.{{Cite web | url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2019/02/tegan-and-sara-tease-new-album.html |title = Tegan and Sara Share New Details of Forthcoming Album|date = February 12, 2019}} On July 9, 2019, they announced via [[Instagram]] that their ninth album would be called ''[[Hey, I'm Just Like You]]'', and would consist of twelve re-recorded songs they initially wrote as teenagers. It was released on September 27, 2019,{{Cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BzsxYgul-D0/|title=Tegan and Sara on Instagram: "The new Tegan and Sara album Hey, I'm Just Like You, Out September 27. Last year while writing our new memoir, we came across two cassette..."|website=[[Instagram]]|language=en|access-date=2019-07-11}} three days after the release of their memoir. In April 2020, the duo created a live "show" that they named ''Where Does the Good Grow'', to entertain their fans during the [[COVID-19 pandemic]]. On May 12, 2020, they announced that they were releasing merchandise designed by [[EE Storey]] for ''Where Does the Good Grow''. The show was held every Thursday at 3 PM PST on their [[Instagram]] account, until the series finale on July 23, 2020.{{Cite web|url=https://events.kcrw.com/events/tegan-sara-where-does-the-good-grow/|title=Tegan & Sara: Where Does The Good Grow?|website=Events.kcrw.com|access-date=October 4, 2020}} In 2021 it was announced that a TV show named ''[[High School (2022 TV series)|High School]]'' based on their memoir of the same name would be filmed in Calgary with [[Clea DuVall]] as the director.{{cite web | url=https://tvseriesfinale.com/tv-show/high-school-imdb-tv-announces-casting-for-series-based-on-memoir-by-tegan-and-sara-quin/ | title=High School: IMDb TV Announces Casting for Series Based on Memoir by Tegan and Sara Quin | date=March 21, 2022 }} Two twins, Railey and Seazynn Gilliland, were cast as the main characters. The show was filmed from April to June 2022 and was released on Amazon Freevee in fall 2022.{{cite web | url=https://trevordecker.com/2022/06/02/filming-wraps-on-new-freevee-series-based-on-tegan-and-saras-teen-years/ | title=Filming Wraps on New Freevee Series Based on Tegan and Sara's Teen Years | date=June 2, 2022 }} === 2021–present: ''Still Jealous'', New record label, and ''Crybaby'' === In July 2021, Tegan and Sara announced on their social media a return to the studio to work on their tenth studio album.{{cite web | url=https://www.instagram.com/p/CR-AmKtpA1m/ | title=Tegan and Sara on Instagram: "We are officially in the studio producing album #10. This is the first time since we were 19 (Call me!) that we've made music independently (Without a record label) and we hope you're ready for a goth/Metal/Polka mash up! JK! We've been so fortunate to have incredible collaborators throughout our career, and we can't wait for the next chapter of our musical lives. It means a great deal to us that after nine albums you're all still with us, and it's a big part of why we're still passionately writing, recording, and performing music professionally! We've been writing non stop and can't wait for you to hear what we're up to. New music soon. Please standby." }} On February 1, 2022, they announced ''Still Jealous'', a completely acoustic reimagining of ''So Jealous'', which was released on February 11, 2022.{{cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/tegan-sara-announce-reimagined-version-of-so-jealous-album-3153376|publisher=NME|title=Tegan & Sara announce reimagined version of 'So Jealous' album|date=February 3, 2022|access-date=2022-02-11}} In April 2022 the duo announced they had left Warner Bros. records and signed a new record deal with Mom & Pop.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2022/music/news/tegan-and-sara-mom-pop-1235253457/|publisher=Variety|title=Tegan and Sara Sign With Mom+Pop Music' news|date=April 28, 2022|access-date=2022-04-28}} They also released the first single, "Fucking Up What Matters", from their upcoming tenth studio album on April 28, 2022. {{cite web | url=https://teganandsara.substack.com/p/what-have-you-fucked-up-that-mattered | title=What Have You Fucked up That Mattered? }} On July 12, 2022, the duo announced the album is called ''Crybaby'' and would be released on October 21, 2022. The second single, "Yellow", was released on the same day, with the music video being released on YouTube.{{cite web | url=https://www.stereogum.com/2192732/tegan-and-sara-crybaby-yellow/music/ | title=Tegan and Sara Announce New Album 'Crybaby': Hear "Yellow" | date=July 12, 2022 }} The twins also announced their first tour in three years, which starts in Philadelphia, PA on October 26, 2022 and ends in Vancouver, BC on November 20.{{cite web | url=https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/tegan-sara-announce-album-crybaby-160505030.html | title=Tegan and Sara Announce New Album Crybaby, Fall 2022 Tour Dates }} ==Influences== Tegan and Sara have credited [[Green Day]], [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]], and [[Hole (band)|Hole]] for "truly start[ing] to cement our desire to write and make our own music".{{cite magazine|last=Nostro|first=Lauren|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2013/01/tegan-and-saras-25-favorite-albums/|title=Tegan and Sara's 25 Favorite Albums|magazine=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]] |date=January 29, 2013|access-date=March 16, 2016}} During their teenage years, the duo were influenced by [[Hayden (musician)|Hayden]], [[the Smashing Pumpkins]], [[Violent Femmes]], [[Dinosaur Jr.]], and [[Teenage Fanclub]].{{cite web|last=Moon|first=Jin|url=http://www.ascap.com/playback/2005/summer/radar/tegan_sara.aspx|title=TWINS PEAK - Tegan and Sara|publisher=[[ASCAP]]|date=July 1, 2005|access-date=March 17, 2016}} Other artists who have influenced Tegan and Sara include [[Depeche Mode]],{{Cite web|title=VIA's Polaris Music Project! THE FAN on @TeganandSara's "Sainthood"|url=https://www.vancouverisawesome.com/events-and-entertainment/vias-polaris-music-project-the-fan-on-tegan-and-saras-sainthood-1921313|access-date=2020-07-30|website=Vancouver Is Awesome|language=en}}{{Cite web|last=Masley|first=Ed|title=11/17: Interview- Tegan and Sara embrace power of pop|url=https://www.azcentral.com/story/entertainment/music/2014/11/12/interview-tegan-sara-phoenix/18946705/|access-date=2020-07-30|website=The Arizona Republic|language=en-US}} [[Rihanna]],{{cite web|last=Trunick|first=Austin|date=January 22, 2013|url=http://www.undertheradarmag.com/interviews/track-by-track_tegan_and_sara_heartthrob_part_two/|title=Track-by-Track: Tegan and Sara's Heartthrob Part Two| url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130530082018/http://www.undertheradarmag.com/interviews/track-by-track_tegan_and_sara_heartthrob_part_two/|archive-date=May 30, 2013|work=[[Under the Radar (magazine)|Under the Radar]]|access-date=March 16, 2016}}{{cite web|last=Copsey|first=Robert|date=February 13, 2013|url=https://www.digitalspy.com/music/a458439/tegan-and-sara-song-i-was-a-fool-inspired-by-rihanna |title=Tegan and Sara song 'I Was A Fool' inspired by Rihanna|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]. [[Hearst Corporation]]|access-date=November 1, 2021}} [[Taylor Swift]],{{cite magazine|last=Appleford|first=Steve|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/behind-tegan-and-saras-big-night-with-taylor-swift-20130823|title=Behind Tegan and Sara's Big Night With Taylor Swift|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |date=August 23, 2013|access-date=March 17, 2016}} [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Kate Bush]], [[David Bowie]], [[Mike Elizondo]],{{cite web | first= Erin Lyndal| last= Martin |url=http://thequietus.com/articles/11414-tegan-sara-interview|title=Shock To Your System: Tegan Of Tegan & Sara Interviewed |date=February 18, 2013 |work=[[The Quietus]] |access-date=March 16, 2016}} [[Pink (singer)|Pink]], [[Lily Allen]],{{cite magazine|url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2012/10/new-music-tegan-and-sara-im-not-your-hero/|title=New Music: Tegan and Sara – "I'm Not Your Hero"|last=Coplan|first=Chris|date=October 21, 2012|magazine=[[Consequence of Sound]]|access-date=March 17, 2016}} [[Erasure]], [[Ace of Base]],{{cite web |last=Trunick |first=Austin |title=Track-by-Track: Tegan and Sara's Heartthrob Part One |work=[[Under the Radar (magazine)|Under the Radar]] |date=January 21, 2013 |url=http://www.undertheradarmag.com/interviews/track-by-track_tegan_and_saras_heartthrob_part_one/ |access-date=March 16, 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130530075639/http://www.undertheradarmag.com/interviews/track-by-track_tegan_and_saras_heartthrob_part_one/ |archive-date=May 30, 2013 |df=mdy-all }} [[Tom Petty]], [[Britney Spears]], [[Katy Perry]],{{cite web|last=Daniels|first=Colin|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/new-music/news/a451092/tegan-and-sara-unveil-new-song-i-was-a-fool-listen/|title=Tegan and Sara unveil new song 'I Was a Fool' - listen|website=[[Digital Spy]]|date=January 15, 2013|access-date=March 16, 2016}} [[Ani DiFranco]], [[the New Pornographers]], [[Cyndi Lauper]], [[Sinéad O'Connor]], [[Against Me!]], and [[Bruce Springsteen]]. ==Personal lives== Tegan and Sara are [[identical twins]] born September 19, 1980, in [[Calgary]]. Both are openly [[gay]] and married.{{cite web|url= https://twitter.com/teganandsara/status/1455596459433152513 |title= Tegan and Sara - Official Twitter |website=twitter.com |date=November 2, 2021 |access-date=November 2, 2021}}{{cite web |url=http://www.undertheradarmag.com/interviews/tegan_and_sara_tegan_quin_marriage_equality/ |title=Tegan and Sara's Tegan Quin on Marriage Equality |last=Norris |first=John |date=October 29, 2012 |website=[[Under the Radar (magazine)|Under the Radar]] |access-date=October 29, 2014}} In August 2022, Sara welcomed her first child.{{Cite web |title=Tegan and Sara's Sara Quin Welcomes First Baby With Partner |url=https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/tegan-sara-sara-quin-welcomes-224912926.html |access-date=2022-08-03 |website=www.yahoo.com |language=en-US}} At the age of 19, both Quins moved from their hometown of Calgary to Vancouver. In 2003, Sara moved to Montreal. {{cite web |last1=Mckenzie |first1=Kevin Hinton & Ryan |title=BCLiving |url=https://www.bcliving.ca/summer-in-vancouver-with-tegan-and-sara |website=BCLiving |access-date=11 October 2022 |language=en}} For many years, Tegan lived in both [[Vancouver, B.C.]] and [[Los Angeles]] while Sara lived in [[Montreal]] and [[New York City]]. As of 2019,{{cite web |last1=Nicholson |first1=Rebecca |title=Tegan and Sara: 'People never talk about women and drug use positively' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2019/sep/18/tegan-and-sara-people-never-talk-about-women-and-drug-use-positively |website=the Guardian |access-date=11 October 2022 |language=en |date=18 September 2019}} both Tegan and Sara moved back to live in [[Vancouver, BC]].{{cite web |last1=You |first1=Tube |title=Iskew: 'Live from my living room with Tegan Quin' |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vj2LRpXx9A&list=LL&index=12&t=2298s |website=Youtbe |access-date=16 October 2022 |language=en |date=12 February 2021}} Tegan and Sara are active politically and socially engaged. They are both advocates for [[LGBT|LGBTQ]] equality as well as music education, literacy, and cancer research.{{cite web| url=https://www.teganandsarafoundation.org/letter-continued |title=Letter from Tegan and Sara|publisher= Tegan and Sara Foundation|access-date=September 28, 2019}} The sisters are cousins with musician Jen Twynn Payne, drummer and lead vocalist for the Vancouver-based band [[The Courtneys]].{{cite web |last1=Mckenzie |first1=Kevin Hinton & Ryan |title=BCLiving |url=https://www.bcliving.ca/summer-in-vancouver-with-tegan-and-sara |website=BCLiving |access-date=11 October 2022 |language=en}} ==Activism and involvement in the LGBT community== In December 2016, and in the wake of the United States' [[2016 United States presidential election|presidential election]], the sisters founded the Tegan and Sara Foundation, to fight for "economic justice, health and representation for LGBTQ girls and women".{{Cite web|url=https://www.teganandsarafoundation.org/about/|title= About|publisher= Tegan and Sara Foundation|language=en-US|access-date=February 6, 2017|quote=Tegan and Sara have openly identified as queer since the beginning of their career in 1998...}} They have since partnered with [[Kiehl's]] cosmetics to release Ultra Facial cleansers with limited edition packaging in order to raise funds for the foundation.{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/TeganandSara/posts/10154828904699110 |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/iarchive/facebook/29144989109/10154828904699110 |archive-date=2022-02-26 |url-access=limited|publisher= Tegan and Sara |title= We are thrilled to announce our first big... |website= Facebook.com| language= en| access-date= February 6, 2017}}{{cbignore}} Profits from ''The Con X: Covers'' and a portion of ticket prices from ''The Con''{{'}}s tenth anniversary tour went to the Tegan and Sara Foundation. At the end of The Con 10th anniversary tour in 2017, they stated they plan to take two years off from touring to focus on the Tegan and Sara Foundation and to make a new record.{{Cite web|url=https://ew.com/music/2017/10/25/tegan-and-sara-the-con-x-covers-tour-album-anniversary-interview/|title=Tegan and Sara look back on the 'mayhem' of making 'The Con': 'I was a disaster'|website=EW.com}} In 2013, the band partnered with [[Coolhaus]], their "favourite ice cream sandwich truck",{{cite journal |last=McNeil |first=Jason |date=October 8, 2013 |title=Tegan and Sara Create 'Marriage Equality' Ice Cream Sandwich |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2013/10/08/tegan-and-sara-marriage-equality-ice-cream_n_4064512.html |journal=[[The Huffington Post|Huffpost Music]] |location=Canada |access-date=October 27, 2014}} to create an ice cream sandwich in favour of [[same-sex marriage]]. The sandwich featured Double Chocolate cookies and Salted Caramel ice cream and was named "Til Death Do Us Part".{{cite web |url=http://teganandsara.tumblr.com/post/62653199769/come-support-us-in-ny-as-we-perform-closer-on-the |title=Come support us in NY as we perform Closer on the Today Show ... |last1=Quin |first1=Tegan |last2=Quin |first2=Sara |year=2013 |website=Official [[Tumblr]] of Tegan and Sara |access-date=October 29, 2014}} In 2012, they appeared on the cover of ''[[Under the Radar (magazine)|Under the Radar]]'' magazine's "Protest" issue. Both were photographed holding a sign that read "The rights of the minority should never be subject to the whim of the majority."{{cite web|last=Redfern |first=Mark |url=http://www.undertheradarmag.com/news/under_the_radars_protest_issue_featuring_dan_deacon_and_tegan_and_sara_cove/ |title=Under the Radar's Protest Issue featuring Dan Deacon and Tegan and Sara Covers is Now on Stands | Under the Radar - Music Magazine |website=Undertheradarmag.com |access-date=June 3, 2016}} Also in Canada, they were actively supporting [[Quebec]] students in their protest against that provincial government. In the U.S., both were vocal during [[California]]'s [[2008 California Proposition 8|Prop 8]] debates.{{cite web| first= Aaron | last= Brophy |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2012/10/16/tegan-and-sara-gay-rights-womens-rights-republicans-election_n_1970622.html |title=Tegan And Sara on Gay Rights, Women's Rights And Republican Wrongs |website=Huffingtonpost.ca |date=October 16, 2012 |access-date=June 3, 2016}} On November 10, 2016, rather than boycotting [[North Carolina]] for [[Public Facilities Privacy & Security Act|HB2]], Tegan and Sara performed at [[The Orange Peel]] and donated their proceeds to [[Equality North Carolina]] in order to fight the legislation.{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/TeganandSara/photos/a.389205624109.166758.29144989109/10154691881719110/?type=3&theater |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/iarchive/facebook/29144989109/10154691881719110 |archive-date=2022-02-26 |url-access=limited|publisher= Tegan and Sara |title= To boycott North Carolina would be a... |website= Facebook.com|language=en|access-date=February 6, 2017}}{{cbignore}} This inspired the band [[Matt and Kim]] to match their donation in the form of merchandise proceeds.{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/TeganandSara/photos/a.389205624109.166758.29144989109/10154695705299110/?type=3&theater |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/iarchive/facebook/29144989109/10154695705299110 |archive-date=2022-02-26 |url-access=limited|publisher= Tegan and Sara |title= Thank you @mattandkim !!!! We will fight... |website= Facebook.com|language=en|access-date=February 6, 2017}}{{cbignore}} Due to the expansion of their audience they have gained a higher profile in the LGBTQ community. They were awarded Outstanding Music Artist at the [[GLAAD Media Award]]s, beating out high-profile musicians including [[Lady Gaga]] and [[Elton John]].{{cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/music/2014/04/16/tegan_and_sara_embrace_role_as_gay_ambassadors.html|title=Tegan and Sara embrace role as gay ambassadors | Toronto Star|date=April 16, 2014|website=TheStar.com|first= Joel| last= Eastwood|access-date=June 3, 2016}} In June 2014, Tegan and Sara joined [[WorldPride]] to perform in the closing ceremonies at [[Yonge–Dundas Square]] in downtown [[Toronto]].{{cite web|url=http://www.curvemag.com/Curve-Magazine/Events/Festivals/2014-JUNO-Award-Winners-Tegan-and-Sara-Join-WorldPride-2014/ |title=2014 JUNO Award Winners Tegan and Sara Join WorldPride 2014 - Curve Magazine - Web Articles 2014 - USA |website=Curvemag.com |date=April 15, 2014 |access-date=June 3, 2016}} The duo partnered with Revel & Riot to create a T-shirt that would fund Revel & Riot's mission for LGBTQ rights. The "Animals" T-shirt features Tegan and Sara, a turtle, fox, koala, penguin, and a dragonfly all labeled with their Latin names. The text at the bottom reads "Gay behaviour is found in over 1500 species. LGBTQ equality now." All proceeds of the sale go to benefit the work of Revel & Riot.{{cite web|access-date=November 27, 2015|website=Teganandsara.com| title=Animals Shirt Collab with Revel & Riot!|date=September 10, 2013|url= http://teganandsara.com/animals-shirt-collab-with-revel-riot/}} ==Touring== [[File:Tegan and Sara @ NIB Stadium (4 12 2010) (5252473341).jpg|thumb|upright|Tegan at [[NIB Stadium]] in December 2010]] [[File:Tegan and Sara @ NIB Stadium (4 12 2010) (5252473149).jpg|thumb|upright|Sara at NIB Stadium in December 2010]] Tegan and Sara began touring after graduating from high school in 1998, travelling by car or [[Greyhound Lines|Greyhound]] bus.{{cite web|url=http://teganandsara.com/uncategorized/thoughts-on-home/|title=thoughts on home|last=Quin|first=Tegan|date=January 28, 2010|publisher=Tegan and Sara|access-date=July 19, 2010}} In 2000, they toured with [[Neil Young]] and [[the Pretenders]]. Other notable touring mates include [[Ryan Adams]], [[Weezer]], [[Bryan Adams]], [[Jack Johnson (musician)|Jack Johnson]], [[the Black Keys]], [[Ben Folds]], [[Gogol Bordello]], [[Cake (band)|Cake]], [[City and Colour]], [[Death Cab for Cutie]], [[Hot Hot Heat]], [[the Killers]], [[New Found Glory]], [[Paramore]], [[Rufus Wainwright]], [[Eugene Francis Jnr]], [[the Jezabels]], [[An Horse]], [[Steel Train]], [[Holly Miranda]], and [[Speak (band)|Speak]]. The sisters are known to do a lot of onstage banter, which often includes stories and commentary about their childhood, [[politics]], and life on the road; this has become a characteristic trait of their live shows.{{cite news|last1=Coyle|first1=Jake|title=Tegan and Sara make on-stage banter a trademark|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/life/music/2008-04-26-1004580226_x.htm| access-date= July 2, 2014| work=USA Today|agency= Associated Press|date=April 26, 2008}}{{cite news| url= http://www.stereogum.com/9397/tegan_sara_are_indie_rocks_laurel_hardy/video/ |title= Tegan & Sara Are Indie Rock's Laurel & Hardy| first= Scott |last= Lapatine | date= April 28, 2008 | website= stereogum.com| access-date= June 5, 2017}} They have performed at festivals including the [[Mariposa Folk Festival]] 2001, [[Sarah McLachlan]]'s [[Lilith Fair]] 1999, 2010, [[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival|Coachella]] 2005, 2008, 2013 [[Lollapalooza]], [[South by Southwest|SXSW]] 2005, 2013, [[Austin City Limits Music Festival|Austin City Limits]], [[Bonnaroo Music Festival|Bonnaroo]], [[Falls Festival]], [[Sasquatch! Music Festival|Sasquatch!]] 2010, [[Osheaga Festival|Osheaga]], [[Cyndi Lauper]]'s [[True Colors Tour]] 2008; [[Southbound (festival)|Southbound]] 2009, [[Glastonbury Festival|Glastonbury]] 2010, Lilith Fair, Australia's [[Groovin' the Moo]] 2010 and 2013, [[Splendour in the Grass]] 2016, [[Winnipeg Folk Festival]] 2011,{{cite web|url=http://teganandsara.com/presskit/TS_Biography_2009.pdf|title=Press Kit – Biography|publisher=Tegan and Sara|access-date=February 11, 2010|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121030063133/http://teganandsara.com/presskit/TS_Biography_2009.pdf|archive-date=October 30, 2012}} [[Newport Folk Festival]] 2011, [[Saskatchewan Jazz Festival|saskTel Saskatchewan Jazz Festival]] 2011, [[Ottawa Bluesfest|Cisco Ottawa Bluesfest]] 2011 and 2015, [[Outside Lands Music and Arts Festival|Outside Lands]] 2014, and [[Firefly Music Festival|Firefly]] 2014, and Area506 in August 2017 in Saint John, New Brunswick. They performed at the ending ceremony in June at Toronto World Pride 2014 and also at [[Boston Calling Music Festival|Boston Calling]] in May 2014. In 2013, Tegan and Sara opened for the band [[Fun (band)|fun.]] on their [[Most Nights Tour|Most Nights Summer Tour]] which started in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]] on July 6 and ended in [[Bridgeport, Connecticut]] on September 28. In January 2014, [[Katy Perry]] announced that Tegan and Sara, along with [[Capital Cities (band)|Capital Cities]] and [[Kacey Musgraves]] would be the opening acts for the North American leg of her [[Prismatic World Tour]]. Tegan and Sara toured with Perry from September to October 2014. On February 25, 2014, Tegan and Sara announced their Let's Make Things Physical Tour. The tour included a range of supporting acts for different cities, including [[Lucius (band)|Lucius]], [[the Courtneys]], [[Waters (band)|Waters]], and My Midnight Heart.{{cite news|title=Let's Make Things Physical Tour|url=http://www.teganandsara.com/lets-make-things-physical-tour/|newspaper=Tegan and Sara|access-date=March 27, 2014|date=February 25, 2014}} The tour kicked off on 6 May in Columbia, Missouri, ending in November 2014. In July 2014, the pair opened for [[Lady Gaga]]'s 2014 concert tour, [[ArtRave: The Artpop Ball|ArtRave: The Artpop Ball Tour]] in [[Quebec City]] in front of a crowd of 80,000.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/teganandsara/status/485239510981025792 |title=Tegan and Sara on Twitter: Career high. Thank you @ladygaga and thank you Quebec City. You can't know how mental this was. :) |publisher=Twitter.com |date=July 5, 2014 |access-date=May 4, 2016}} In 2015, the sisters weren't touring, taking time off to write and record their eighth studio album ''[[Love You to Death (album)|Love You to Death]]'', which was officially released on June 3, 2016.{{cite web| first= Evan |last= Minsker |url=http://pitchfork.com/news/62533-tegan-and-sara-announce-new-album-love-you-to-death/ |title=Tegan and Sara Announce New Album Love You to Death |website= pitchfork.com |date=March 10, 2016 |access-date=May 13, 2016}} On April 25, 2016, their worldwide 2016 tour in support of ''Love You to Death'' was announced.{{cite web|url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2016/04/tegan-and-sara-announce-massive-2016-tour/|title=Tegan and Sara announce massive 2016 tour|last=Geslani|first=Michelle|website=Consequence of Sound|access-date=May 2, 2016|date=April 25, 2016}} The tour started in [[London]], UK, passing through Australia, [[Hong Kong]], [[Singapore]], and [[Taiwan]] in July, Canada and the United States. Tegan and Sara were a part of the [[WayHome Music & Arts Festival|WayHome]] summer 2017 line-up in [[Oro-Medonte]], Ontario.{{Cite web|url=http://wayhome.com/|title=WayHome Music & Arts|website=WayHome.com| archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20170217041844/http://wayhome.com/| url-status= live| archive-date= February 17, 2017 |language=en-US|access-date=February 21, 2017}} ===Collaborations and other work=== In 2009, Tegan and Sara worked as producers for the first time. Tegan worked with char2d2 on the 2009 ''Small Vampires EP'', while Sara worked on the 2010 debut albums for [[Fences (band)|Fences]] and [[Hesta Prynn]]. ====Tegan==== Tegan appeared on [[Against Me!]]'s song "Borne of the FM Waves of the Heart", and also appeared in the music video. She also sang backing vocals on [[Rachael Cantu]]'s "Saturday" from her ''[[Run All Night (album)|Run All Night]]''. In April 2008, Tegan wrote and recorded a song titled "His Love" at the request of [[Augusten Burroughs]] as a contribution to the audio version of his book ''[[A Wolf at the Table]]''. The two headlined [[Spin (magazine)|''Spin'']]'s September 2008 Liner Notes benefit for [[Housing Works]], a New York non-profit.{{cite news|url=https://www.spin.com/2008/07/tegan-quin-augusten-burroughs-co-headline-spins-liner-notes-event/|title=Tegan Quin, Augusten Burroughs Co-Headline SPIN's 'Liner Notes' Event|date=July 21, 2008|work=Spin|access-date=March 26, 2010}} Tegan sang with [[Jim Ward (musician)|Jim Ward]] on his track "Broken Songs" and on the song "Contrails" by rapper [[Astronautalis]] which appeared on his 2011 album ''[[This Is Our Science]]''. She also appeared in the music video. Tegan was also featured in one of the songs off of [[Dan Mangan]]'s new LP ''Unmake'', titled "Forgetery Redux".{{cite web|url=http://www.readdork.com/news/dan-mangan-releases-surprise-ep-featuring-tegan-quin-collaboration-robyn-cover/|title=Dan Mangan releases 'surprise' EP, featuring Tegan Quin collaboration and Robyn cover | Dork|last=Sinden|first=Victoria|date=June 17, 2016|website=Readdork.com|access-date=August 2, 2016}} In 2017, Tegan was featured on [[Ria Mae]]'s album on the song "Broken". ====Sara==== Sara sings on [[The Reason (band)|the Reason]]'s song "We're So Beyond This", and also appears in the music video. She was featured on rapper/songwriter/producer [[Theophilus London]]'s track "Why Even Try" from his 2011 ''Lovers Holiday'' EP. Sara appears on [[Jonathan Coulton]]'s 2011 album ''[[Artificial Heart (album)|Artificial Heart]]'', providing vocals for the album's remake of the song Coulton wrote for [[Valve Corporation|Valve]]'s game ''[[Portal (video game)|Portal]]'', "[[Still Alive]]". Sara covered [[Alicia Keys]]' "[[Try Sleeping with a Broken Heart]]" from [[Doveman]]'s Burgundy Stain Sessions in 2011. In [[Kaki King]]'s music video for "Pull Me Out Alive", Sara can be seen as well. Sara sang back-up vocals on two songs from former [[Smashing Pumpkins]] member [[James Iha]]'s 2012 album ''[[Look to the Sky]]'': "To Who Knows Where" and "Dream Tonight".{{cite web|title=Sara Quin {{!}} Credits|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/sara-quin-mn0001857206|publisher=Allmusic.com|access-date=April 20, 2014}} ====Together==== * Tegan and Sara performed with DJ [[Tiësto]] during the Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival on June 13, 2008. Tegan and Sara appeared as guests, providing live vocals for Tiësto's remix of "Back in Your Head", in addition to their own set that night. The duo also collaborated with Tiësto on the song "[[Feel It in My Bones]]" from his 2009 album ''[[Kaleidoscope (Tiësto album)|Kaleidoscope]]'' and appeared in the music video for this song. They later called the song "the first time we'd co-written with somebody, so it was the first time someone was giving us feedback on what we'd written... Sara and I were both so obsessed with him liking the song enough to put it on his record that we both were writing on it. It was a true collaboration; there's like two sections that Sara wrote, and three that I wrote."{{cite web |url= http://www.vulture.com/2016/06/tegan-and-sara-pick-their-10-best-songs.html |title=Tegan and Sara Pick Their 10 Best Songs|first= Dee|last= Lockett|work=vulture.com |date= June 3, 2016|access-date=July 2, 2016}} * Tegan and Sara are featured on [[Margaret Cho]]'s 2009 album ''[[Cho Dependent]]'' on the track "Intervention".{{Cite web|url=http://teganandsara.com/intervention-with-margaret-cho/|title=Intervention with Margaret Cho!|website=teganandsara.com|date=December 2, 2010|access-date=February 4, 2018}} They are also featured in the song's video. * An "[[Alligator (Tegan and Sara song)|Alligator]]" remix EP was released by the duo on [[iTunes]] in 2010. The EP consisted of remixes of their song "Alligator" by different artists. Contributors included Doveman, [[Four Tet]], [[Passion Pit]], [[Ra Ra Riot]], and [[VHS or Beta]]. * In December 2010, Tegan and Sara collaborated with the [[Yellow Bird Project]] to produce a charity T-shirt. The shirt was designed by [[EE Storey]] with all profits benefiting FIERCE NYC, an organization that builds the leadership and power of [[LGBT|LGBTQ]] communities in New York City.{{cite web|first= Caroline| last= Walker |url=http://act.mtv.com/posts/indie-rockers-give-back-by-designing-tees/ |title=Indie Rockers Give Back By Designing Tees |publisher=Act.mtv.com |date=September 30, 2011 |access-date=August 21, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150223111247/http://act.mtv.com/posts/indie-rockers-give-back-by-designing-tees/ |archive-date=February 23, 2015}} * They both appear in [[Sara Bareilles]]' music video for her song "[[Uncharted (song)|Uncharted]]". The video premiered in March 2011 and also features, amongst others, [[Josh Groban]], [[Laura Jansen]], [[Ingrid Michaelson]], [[Pharrell Williams]], [[Adam Levine]], [[Ben Folds]], [[Keenan Cahill]], [[Jennifer Nettles]], and [[Vanessa Carlton]]. * [[NOFX]]'s controversial song "Creeping Out Sara" is about the two sisters. It is based on an encounter between [[Fat Mike]] of NOFX and Sara while backstage at a music festival. During a live Q&A when asked what they thought of the song Sara answered, "The song is called 'Creeping Out Sara'; I am Sara, and I was creeped out." * The sisters collaborated with [[Morgan Page]] on his songs "Body Work" and "Video", which were both on his 2012 album ''[[In the Air (Morgan Page album)|In the Air]]''. They also appeared in the music video for "Body Work". * Another collaboration with a dance artist was on a song with [[David Guetta]] and [[Alesso]] for Guetta's re-release album ''[[Nothing but the Beat#2.0|Nothing but the Beat 2.0]]''. The song, "Every Chance We Get We Run", was released on September 10, 2012. * Tegan and Sara have both ventured into songwriting for other artists. This includes two songs "A Hot Minute" and "The Worst" featured in [[Lisa Loeb]]'s 2013 release ''No Fairy Tale''.{{cite web| website= Allmusic.com| title= No Fairy Tale|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/no-fairy-tale-mw0002448165|access-date=February 9, 2013}} Sara also co-wrote "Sweetie" which was included in the deluxe edition of [[Carly Rae Jepsen]]'s album ''[[Kiss (Carly Rae Jepsen album)|Kiss]]''. * In 2012, the sisters covered [[Cyndi Lauper]]'s hit song "[[Time After Time (Cyndi Lauper song)|Time After Time]]". * In 2012, Tegan and Sara covered [[the Rolling Stones]]' "[[Fool to Cry]]" for the [[HBO]] series ''[[Girls (TV series)|Girls Soundtrack Vol. 1]]''. * In 2013, Tegan and Sara released a [[Closer (Tegan and Sara song)#Digital remix EP|"Closer" remix EP]] containing contributions from artists such as [[Sultan & Shepard]], [[the Knocks]], and [[Yeasayer]]. * In 2013, Tegan and Sara released "Shudder to Think" for the ''[[Dallas Buyers Club]]'' movie soundtrack. * In 2013, Tegan and Sara were featured on [[Matthew Dear]]'s cover of the [[Tears for Fears]] song "[[Pale Shelter]]". * In 2013, the Canadian duo covered [[Pink (singer)|Pink]]'s "[[Just Like a Pill]]" for [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard's'']] [[Billboard Women in Music|Women in Music]] 2013. * In 2014, Tegan and Sara released "Find Another Love" for the [[Endless Love (2014 American film)|''Endless Love'']] movie soundtrack. * In 2014, Tegan and Sara sang the jingle "Dare to Wonder" for the [[Oreo]] Wonderfilled cookies TV commercial.{{cite web|url=http://www.adweek.com/adfreak/tegan-and-sara-sing-latest-oreo-commercial-and-its-pretty-great-155480|title=Tegan and Sara Sing the Latest Oreo Commercial, and It's Pretty Great|last=Kiefaber|first=David|date=February 4, 2014| website= Adweek.com |access-date=August 21, 2014}} * The same year, they sang "[[Everything Is Awesome]]", the theme song for ''[[The Lego Movie]]'', with [[the Lonely Island]]. The song was also nominated for an [[Academy Award for Best Original Song]]. * In 2014, Tegan and Sara co-wrote and sang the song "Hard to Hold" on the [[RAC (musician)|RAC]] album ''Strangers, Pt. 1''.{{cite web|url=http://www.teganandsara.com/strangers-pt-i |title=Strangers, Pt. I Collaboration! |publisher=Tegan and Sara |date=March 4, 2014 |access-date=August 21, 2014}} * The duo also were featured on "When You Were Mine" by [[Night Terrors of 1927]]. * In September 2014, they released a remix EP of "[[I Was a Fool]]". * In 2015, they performed with the Lonely Island at the [[Academy Awards|Oscars]], representing their collaboration for ''The Lego Movie'' in "Everything Is Awesome". * In March 2015, the duo collaborated with Sultan & Shepard on the song "Make Things Right". * In 2017, they collaborated with [[All Time Low]] on the song "Ground Control" for All Time Low's seventh studio album, ''[[Last Young Renegade]]''.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/features/time-low-tegan-sara-discuss-huge-new-collaboration-2083018|title=All Time Low and Tegan & Sara discuss their huge new collaboration, pop-punk, 'Last Young Renegade' and the future|date=June 2, 2017|publisher=[[NME]]|access-date=October 28, 2020}} * In 2017, they again worked with Matthew Dear to create "Bad Ones".{{Cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/allsongs/2017/08/29/546794340/matthew-dear-and-tegan-and-sara-address-the-bad-ones|title=Matthew Dear and Tegan and Sara Address the 'Bad Ones'|newspaper=[[NPR]]|date=August 29, 2017|access-date=February 4, 2018|last1=Gotrich|first1=Lars}} *In 2020, they collaborated with [[Alex Hope (songwriter)|Alex Hope]] to create a song for the film [[Happiest Season]] titled "Make You Mine This Season". *In 2021, they were featured on an alternate version of [[Beach Bunny (band)|Beach Bunny]]'s song "[[Cloud 9 (Beach Bunny song)|Cloud 9]]". *In 2021, they were featured on [[Vincint]]'s song "[[Getaway (Vincint song)|Getaway]]". {| class="wikitable collapsible collapsed" style="width:100%;" |- !colspan=5 | List of joint and solo collaborations |- ! Bang!]]'' (2016), ''[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]]'' (2016, 2019), and ''[[ZeD]]''.{{cite web|url=http://abc.go.com/watch/jimmy-kimmel-live/SH559060/VD55269317/jimmy-kimmel-live-13113|title= ''Jimmy Kimmel Live'' 1/31/13| quote= Actress Jennifer Lawrence; TV host Katie Couric; Tegan and Sara perform.|work= ABC. |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130204000323/http://abc.go.com/watch/jimmy-kimmel-live/SH559060/VD55269317/jimmy-kimmel-live-13113 |archive-date=February 4, 2013 |access-date=February 2, 2013}}{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/tegan-and-sara-ill-be-back-someday-origin-story-colbert-892192/|title=See Tegan and Sara Perform 'I'll Be Back Someday,' Talk Origin Story on 'Colbert'|last=Kreps|first=Daniel|date=September 28, 2019|magazine=Rolling Stone|access-date=September 28, 2019}} Tegan and Sara songs have been featured in the films ''[[Dallas Buyers Club]]'', ''[[The Lego Movie]]'', ''[[G.B.F. (film)|G.B.F.]]'', ''[[Monster-in-Law]]'', ''[[Sweet November (2001 film)|Sweet November]]'', ''[[These Girls]]'', and ''[[The Carmilla Movie]]'', and in the television shows ''[[Degrassi: The Next Generation]]'', ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'', ''[[Being Erica]]'', ''[[Ghost Whisperer]]'', ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'', ''[[The Hills (TV series)|The Hills]]'', ''[[Hollyoaks]]'', ''[[jPod (TV series)|jPod]]'', ''[[The L Word]]'', ''[[Life Unexpected]]'', ''[[Melrose Place (2009 TV series)|Melrose Place]]'', ''[[One Tree Hill (TV series)|One Tree Hill]]'', ''[[Parenthood (2010 TV series)|Parenthood]]'', ''[[Rookie Blue]]'', ''[[The Vampire Diaries (TV series)|The Vampire Diaries]]'', ''[[Veronica Mars]]'', ''[[Waterloo Road (TV series)|Waterloo Road]]'', ''[[What's New, Scooby-Doo?]]'', ''[[Awkward (TV series)|Awkward]]'', [[Riverdale (2017 TV series)|''Riverdale'']], [[Girls (TV series)|''Girls'']], and ''[[BoJack Horseman]].'' Their song "[[Closer (Tegan and Sara song)|Closer]]" was covered by ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]'' on the episode "[[Feud (Glee)|Feud]]" which aired March 14, 2013 at 9 pm EST on [[Global Television Network|Global]] for Canada and [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] for USA. The song is also used in the teaser trailer for the 2013 independent comedy film, ''Exes''. The songs "Closer" and "Back in Your Head" were featured in the 2016 video game ''LOUD on Planet X''. In 2006, Tegan and Sara appeared in ''[[The L Word]]'' episode "Last Dance" (season 3, episode 11); they had a small role in which they played themselves performing their song "Love Type Thing" and exchanged a few lines with main character Dana Fairbanks. In 2008, they appeared on the kids' music television show ''[[Pancake Mountain]]'' where they acted in a skit and performed their songs "Back in Your Head", "Hop a Plane", and an acoustic version of "Walking with a Ghost".{{cite web|url=http://www.pancakemountain.com/news_2007.htm|title=Pancake Mountain News Archives – 2007|last=Stuckey|first=Scott|date=December 6, 2007|publisher=[[Pancake Mountain]]|access-date=January 2, 2011}} In 2010, they appeared on [[CBC Television|CBC]]'s ''[[CBC Kids|Mamma Yamma]]'', revising their single "Alligator" into a children's song. In 2012, Tegan and Sara appeared in the ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'' episode "[[List of 90210 episodes#Season 5 (2012–13)|The Things We Do for Love]]" performing "Closer" and "Now I'm All Messed Up" from their album ''[[Heartthrob (album)|Heartthrob]]''.{{cite web|last=Grabert|first=Jessica|title=Tegan And Sara Will Perform in 90210's Christmas Episode|date=October 4, 2012|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/television/Tegan-Sara-Perform-90210-Christmas-Episode-47781.html|publisher=cinemablend.com|access-date=December 11, 2012}} In 2011, Sara was a panellist on the [[CBC Radio One]] program ''[[Canada Reads]]'', defending [[Jeff Lemire]]'s graphic novel ''[[Essex County Trilogy|Essex County]]''. The book, the first graphic novel to be featured as part of ''Canada Reads'', was voted off after the first round but then later placed No. 1 in a "People's Choice" poll with more votes than all other books combined. In March 2013 during the [[SXSW]] festival, Tegan and Sara co-hosted the [[MTVU#MTVU Woodie Awards|MTVU Woodie Awards]] with rapper [[Machine Gun Kelly (musician)|Machine Gun Kelly]]. They also performed their single "Closer". The Woodie Awards aired on [[MTV]] on March 17, 2013.{{cite web|title=MGK, Tegan And Sara To Host 2013 MTVU Woodie Awards|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1703179/mtvu-woodie-awards-2013-hosts-mgk-tegan-sara.jhtml|publisher=MTV|access-date=March 7, 2013}} On September 30, 2013, Tegan and Sara performed "Closer" on ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]''.{{cite web|last=Brelhan|first=Tom|title=Watch Tegan And Sara Play The Today Show|date=September 30, 2013|url=http://www.stereogum.com/1499431/watch-tegan-and-sara-play-the-today-show/video/|publisher=stereogum.com|access-date=November 14, 2013}} In early 2014, Tegan and Sara collaborated with [[the Lonely Island]] on a song called "[[Everything Is Awesome!!!]]" for ''The Lego Movie'' soundtrack. The movie opened in theatres on February 7, 2014. The song debuted at number 62{{cite magazine|title=Billboard Hot 100| magazine= [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]].com| url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/373137/Tegan+and+Sara/chart?f=379 |access-date= February 23, 2014}} on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] chart and number 24{{cite web| website= BBC.co.uk |title= Official UK Singles Chart|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/chart/singles| access-date= February 23, 2014}} on the Official [[UK Singles Chart]]. Chief songwriter/producer [[Shawn Patterson (composer)|Shawn Patterson]] received an [[Academy Award|Oscar]] nomination for Best Original Song at the 87th Annual Academy Awards, losing to "[[Glory (Common and John Legend song)|Glory]]" by [[John Legend]] and [[Common (rapper)|Common]], from the movie ''[[Selma (film)|Selma]]''. In 2016, the twins had a short appearance on the show [[Take My Wife (2016 TV series)|Take My Wife]] starring [[Cameron Esposito]] and [[River Butcher]] through a special YouTube-released holiday segment. In September 2017, Tegan appeared as a guest on [[Cameron Esposito]]'s podcast, ''[[Queery]]''. In October 2017, Sara was a guest on the show. In October 2019, both sisters appeared together on the podcast. In 2020, their song "Make You Mine This Season" was featured in the film ''[[Happiest Season]]'' starring [[Kristen Stewart]] and [[Mackenzie Davis]]. The film was directed by a friend of theirs, [[Clea DuVall]]. ==Band members== * Tegan Quin – vocals, guitar, keyboards * Sara Quin – vocals, guitar, keyboards === Backing musicians === * Adam Christgau – drums (2013–2014, 2022) * Izzy Fontaine – guitar, keyboards (2022) ===Former backing musicians=== * Aaron Burke – drums (1998–1999) * Marc Tremblay – bass (1998–1999) * Chris Carlson – bass (2002–2006) * Rob Chursinoff – drums (2002–2006) * Ted Gowans – guitar, keyboards (2004–2014) * Johnny Andrews – drums (2005–2010) *Dan Kelly – bass (2007) * [[Shaun Huberts]] – bass (2007–2010) *[[Jason McGerr]] – drums (2012) * Jasper Leak – bass, keyboard bass (2012–2014) * John Spence – keyboards (2012–2014) * [[Eva Gardner]] – bass (2016) *Brendan Buckley – drums (2016–2017) *Vivi Rama – bass (2017) *[[Gabrial McNair]] – keyboards (2016–2017) *Tim Mislock – guitar (2017) ;Timeline
